sentence.Network_cn: 我对欧洲没抱什么幻想。

sentence.Network_en: When they first joined for training many were starry eyed about just sailing around the world. We soon knocked that out of them.
sentence.Network_cn: 在他们参加培训之初，很多人还只是对环球航行抱有天真的想法。我们很快便使他们消除了那种想法。

sentence.Network_en: But no sensible business leader is starry - eyed about sports.
sentence.Network_cn: 但理智的商业领袖不会过分乐观.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 去丛林当间谍 A Spy in... ... 9. go gray: (头发)变得灰白 16. starry-eyed: 幻想的,过分乐观的 20. wear off: 逐渐减弱,消失.
of course , most are starry-eyed adventurers , not serious scientists who want to be on Mars to do great science .当然，大部分都是富于幻想的冒险者，而非想去火星做重大科学研究的严肃的科学家。

if I went to Lago Agrio as myself and pretended to write a story , no one would suspect that the starry-eyed young American poking around was actually shilling for Chevron .如果我亲自去拉戈阿格里奥，假装写一篇报道，没有人会怀疑这个充满幻想的美国姑娘实际上是雪佛龙派来打探消息的。

list.abs: a starry - eyed reformer ; starry - eyed idealism ., 过分乐观的改革者 ; 不切实际的理想主义.
She ' s got some starry - eyed notion about reforming society ., 她对社会改革有些异想天开的想法.
a starry - eyed reformer ; starry - eyed idealism ., 过分乐观的改革者 ; 不切实际的理想主义.

entry.tran: 充满幻想的;想入非非的;不切实际的
entry.def: If you say that someone is starry-eyed, you mean that they have such a positive or hopeful view of a situation that they do not see what it is really like.

example.tran: 我对欧洲没抱什么幻想。

auth_sentence.content: The tax collector was steely eyed, and uncompromising.

auth_sentence.content: The starry strain of spirit, thence we are.

auth_sentence.content: Takeshi Takahashi is hollow-eyed and looks and sounds exhausted.
